metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5427 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
PowerDNS (aka pdns) Authoritative Server before 3.4.10 does not properly handle a . (dot) inside labels, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (backend CPU consumption) via a crafted DNS query.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5427` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-geoip - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-lua - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-mydns - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-server - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-tools - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.0~alpha2-3build1').
